alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 11:32AM MST until January 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER MOVING THROUGH THE INLAND NORTHWEST SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... .A weather system moving through the Inland northwest will impact the Cascades Saturday afternoon and move east Saturday night. Higher concentrations of snow are expected near the Washington Cascade crest, Washington/Idaho Palouse and the central Idaho Panhandle mountains. Winds will increase in the Palouse regions along with snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Potlatch, Rosalia, Oakesdale, Plummer, Uniontown, Tekoa, Colfax, Moscow, Pullman, and Genesee. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions as temperatures drop on wet or snowy roads. Reduced visibility due to gusty winds can be expected.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
